records.name: Jane Austen
records.bio: English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

records.name: Isaac Asimov
records.bio: American writer and professor of biochemistry, known for his works of science fiction and popular science.

records.name: Agatha Christie
records.bio: English writer known for her 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those revolving around fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.

records.name: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
records.bio: Colombian novelist, short-story writer, screenwriter, and journalist, known for his works of magical realism.

records.name: Haruki Murakami
records.bio: Japanese writer. His novels, essays, and short stories have been bestsellers in Japan as well as internationally.
